sentences.en: He died at the end of this wistful and elegiac novel.
sentences.cn: 在这本情意绵绵的哀歌式小说的末尾,他结束了一生.

sentences.en: He felt wistful and then smiled to himself.
sentences.cn: 他感到有些怀念,暗地里还微微一笑.

sentences.en: He looked so wistful as he went away.
He turned to meet the eyes of Ione - earnest, wistful, fearful.
sentences.cn: 他转过脸来和伊俄涅的目光相遇 - 她的眼神诚挚 、 渴望 、 担忧.

sentences.en: His sole reference to Watergate was wistful.
sentences.cn: 他对水门事件的唯一反应就是陷入沉思.

sentences.en: I can't help feeling slightly wistful about the perks I'm giving up.
sentences.cn: 我不禁对自己将要放弃的津贴感到有点儿不舍。

sentences.en: I'm not sad about it. Maybe a little wistful , I guess.
sentences.cn: 对这我不感到悲哀, 也许有一点怅惘.

sentences.en: In old age the two men wrote each other wistful letters.
sentences.cn: 这两个人晚年时互通信函，诉说怀旧感伤之情。

sentences.en: She had a last wistful look at the house.
sentences.cn: 她留恋地最后朝那房子看了一眼.

sentences.en: She was a little wistful or sad, and even a little bitter.
sentences.cn: 她有点怅惘和哀伤, 甚至有点痛苦.

sentences.en: She was not sad, only wistful, blanched.
sentences.cn: 她并不伤心, 只是愁闷,苍白无力.

sentences.en: The boy looked with wistful eyes at the toys on display.
sentences.cn: 那男孩看着展出的玩具,眼中流露出渴望的神情.

sentences.en: The boy looks with wistful eyes at the toy on display.
sentences.cn: 那男孩看著展出的玩具,眼中流露出渴望的神情.

sentences.en: The statue has a gentleness, an ambience, a wistful elegance.
sentences.cn: 那尊雕像具有一种柔和 、 一种独特格调 、 一种忧郁沉思的雅致.

words.tran_cn: 渴望的，愿望的；寄予希望的
渴望地；希望地；不满足地

trans.tran_en: thinking sadly about something you would like to have but cannot have, especially something that you used to have in the past
